funFacts: Depending on how scholars count entering tones, Cantonese is often said to have either 6 or 9 tones—more than twice as many as Mandarin.
Thousands of genuine Cantonese characters (粵字) like 𠵱, 冇, 哋 never appear in Mandarin newspapers and were only added to Unicode in 2017 (Extension F).
The Guinness World Record for ‘longest Cantonese sentence ever broadcast’ belongs to Hong Kong horse-racing commentators who routinely speak over 300 words per minute.
Because Cantonese maintains final consonants lost in Mandarin, machine translators trained on Mandarin struggle with rhyme-based Cantonese wordplay such as 搭枱『daap3 toi2』.
Bruce Lee’s stage name "李小龍" literally translates to ‘Little Dragon Lee,’ but his Cantonese nickname ‘細龍仔’ is untranslatable word-for-word into English.
